title.narrative: Integration of safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy into County development plans

description.narrative: Energy access in Kenya is still low. The country is committed to improving access to safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy, energy efficiency, as well as development and use of renewable energy as precondition for achieving national development goals such as poverty eradication, access to clean water, improved public health and education, women's empowerment and increased food production. The Interrelation between energy and poverty from various countries demonstrate the opportunities vulnerable communities lose when they lack access to affordable, reliable, sustainable, and modern energy services. The project aims to support Effective integration of safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy into County policies, development plans and implementation strategies. specifically, it will (i)Strengthen capacity of Kitui County Government and CSOs/stakeholders towards integrating safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy into policies, plan and strategies ( ii) Develop an advocacy strategy for informed advocacy on integration of safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy into county development plans, police and implementation strategies The expected outcome are -Safe, affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy integrated into Kitui County Policies, plans and implementation strategies -County and stakeholder annual plans and budgets prioritizing safe, affordable, reliable sustainable and modern energy access and delivery. -Enhanced participation of local communities in the planning and delivery of safe, affordable, reliable sustainable and modern energy in kitui County The approaches to be used include - identification of key knowledge gaps and carry out research to inform advocacy strategy - Building capacity of partner for informed advocacy - awareness raising and building understanding of county decision makers The £ 16000/- project will be implemented in a period of 1 year/
